column5: Just wondering if anyone knows if there are any creeks around stoney that have spec"s going up today to put my boats in.Not looking for your hot spots just want to wet a line! .someone out here last yr gave me some info about a creek around norwood lost it.So any info would be great!!!.JUST WANT TO FISH!!!!
Not sure about what you're exactly talking about but come Saturday you might want to look around the blue coloured creeks(cold-water) on this map.

Well I grew up in Norwood and fished almost all the creeks around there and most are full of chubs and bass, but there may be a few untapped gems there.....sorry I couldn't be of any help.  There is a trout pond in between Norwood and Havelock if its still there but it costs an arm and a leg to fish it!
Hey EHG thanks for the map I will check out the cold water areas in the morning.
It's been many moons since I fished it, so not sure what it's like now, but Eels Creek used to have great trout fishing.
Charlied thanks for your responce i will be in norwood this afternoon to pick up my dinner at RALPF"S the bucher great meats there!!!!
YES THERE IS........man I miss that place and the town.
I think there are lake trout in the south section of Jack's lake. Maybe the river running between Jack's and Stoney would have trout.
